page.title: 13FARMING & CEREAL PRODUCTION
page.content:
Of the total block area we estimate that approx. 96% is currently utilised for agricultural purposes.
{CEREAL PRODUCTION} Local agricultural activity is centred around the production of cereal crops with some 65% of the total available farmland cultivated for this purpose.
Major crops combine the traditional barley, wheat and oats with the more recently introdued and increasingly popular oilseed rape.
Cultivation is usually scheduled for the months of September and October and is generally accomplished with a diesel powered tractor pulling a 3, 4 or 5 furrowed plough, the choice of plough being dependant upon field size and available tractor power.
